definition.en: Blackheads (open comedones) are small dark bumps on the skin caused by clogged hair follicles. The black appearance is due to oxidation of sebum and dead skin cells, not dirt.
definition.th: สิวหัวดำ (open comedones) เป็นตุ่มเล็กสีดำบนผิวที่เกิดจากรูขุมขนอุดตัน สีดำเกิดจากการออกซิเดชันของน้ำมันและเซลล์ผิวที่ตาย ไม่ใช่จากสิ่งสกปรก

Avoid touching face with unwashed hands
Change pillowcases weekly
Keep hair off face and wash regularly

statistics.prevalence: 50-80% of people experience blackheads at some point
statistics.location: Most common on nose, chin, and forehead (T-zone)
statistics.age: Peak occurrence during teenage years, but can persist into adulthood
statistics.recurrence: Blackheads can return within 20-40 days without proper skincare
statistics.genetics: Genetics play a 40-50% role in susceptibility to blackheads

myths.fact: The black color is from oxidized sebum and dead skin cells, not dirt. Overwashing can actually worsen blackheads by increasing oil production.

myths.myth: Squeezing blackheads is the best removal method
myths.fact: Improper extraction can damage skin, enlarge pores, cause scarring, and push bacteria deeper. Professional extraction is safer.
Pore strips only provide temporary removal of superficial blackheads. They don't address the root cause and blackheads quickly return.

myths.myth: You can permanently shrink or close pores
myths.fact: Pore size is largely genetic. While you can minimize their appearance with proper care, pores cannot be permanently closed.

morning: Use niacinamide serum to control oil
evening: Double cleanse: oil cleanser first, then salicylic acid cleanser
Use retinol or prescription retinoid (on alternate nights if needed)
Apply niacinamide serum if not using retinoid
weekly: Clay mask 1-2 times per week (kaolin or bentonite)
Gentle enzyme exfoliation 1-2 times per week
Steam face for 5-10 minutes before mask to open pores
Use pore strips sparingly (not more than once per week)

safe.title: Safe At-Home Extraction
steps: Apply warm (not hot) compress for 5-10 minutes
Wrap clean fingers with tissue or cotton
Apply gentle pressure around blackhead (not on it)
If it doesn't release easily, STOP - don't force it
Cleanse area with salicylic acid toner
Apply soothing serum or light moisturizer
safe.warning: Only extract blackheads that are clearly visible and near the surface. For deeper or stubborn blackheads, see a professional.

avoid: Never use fingernails directly on skin
Don't squeeze or pick at skin aggressively
Avoid metal extraction tools without proper training
Don't extract inflamed or painful areas

mostEffective: Salicylic acid (BHA) 2% - penetrates oil and unclogs pores
Retinoids - prevent pore clogging and increase cell turnover
Azelaic acid 10-20% - unclogs pores and reduces oil
Zinc - reduces oil production and inflammation
avoid: Comedogenic ingredients (cocoa butter, wheat germ oil)
Harsh physical scrubs with large particles
